posts.post_content: It's a combo card. As a self contained entity, this thing is worse than a swamp, but put it in the right deck, and you've got something going. Cards like this always find their niche but it takes a special person to appreciate it.

posts.post_content: This card is amazing, and I have yet to have problems with the two I have in my deck. You only need five creatures in the graveyard for it to be effective, and that shouldn't be hard if you have say... 18 creatures, in the deck. People who don't play creature based decks will of course think the card sucks, but that is usually how it goes.

Posted By: UltimaCenturion (10/2/2009 4:32:29 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I've made a really decent legacy deck with this and [songs of the damned](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=songs of the damned). I use [Tortured Existence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tortured Existence) with [Street Wraith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Street Wraith) and Dredge. I can generally get about 12 black creatures in my graveyard around turn 3. Then I can pull back my lost street wraith life with double [Golgari Brownscale](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Golgari Brownscale) and finish off my opponent with a card like [Soul Shriek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Shriek) or just some huge [Consume Spirit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Consume Spirit).  
  
The fact its not legendary means I can use one to power another one to get even more mana.  
  
The fact it taps for Black means even if I don't have the required 4 creatures in my graveyard or two extra mana open, I can still use it to power cards like Tortured Existence or to play a [Putrid Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Putrid Imp) to get my [Stinkweed Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stinkweed Imp) or other Dredge cards into my graveyard faster.  
  
Its not a tier-1 or even competitive deck type though. Its not "kitchen table" though, ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

The fact its not legendary means I can use one to power another one to get even more mana.

The fact it taps for Black means even if I don't have the required 4 creatures in my graveyard or two extra mana open, I can still use it to power cards like Tortured Existence or to play a Putrid Imp to get my Stinkweed Imp or other Dredge cards into my graveyard faster.

Its not a tier-1 or even competitive deck type though. Its not "kitchen table" though, ... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Odd. the effect on Cabal Coffers would have fit this set more flavorfully, and the effect on this would have fit Torment more flavorfully. Oh well. Also, this thing sucks.  
  
It'd be still a somewhat weak card if it counted all creatures in your graveyard, but at least then it'd be playable.  
  
The biggest problem with this card is, if you want it to work, you have to play too many creatures for it to get off smoothly. It's not worth the effort you'd have to put in to get it to work well.
posts.html:
Odd. the effect on Cabal Coffers would have fit this set more flavorfully, and the effect on this would have fit Torment more flavorfully. Oh well. Also, this thing sucks.

It'd be still a somewhat weak card if it counted all creatures in your graveyard, but at least then it'd be playable.

The biggest problem with this card is, if you want it to work, you have to play too many creatures for it to get off smoothly. It's not worth the effort you'd have to put in to get it to work well.
